column1: Narrator : Black smoke raises high in the sky, and an incredible smell floats in the air. It’s a tavern
column3: Narrator : Overlooking the island is a wooden cabin. A pig, with an apple in his mouth is drawn on a sign atop the door. This must be a tavern

column6: Narrator : When CAPITAINE opens the door of the tavern, nobody greets him. The tavern is abandonned to webs and mold

column1: Narrator : At this day of day, the tavern is crowded. Clients scream, fights, and laugh all around.
column2: Narrator : Despite the time of the day, nothing goes on much. The silence rules, and only a few day drinkers sip lighty at their cups
column3: Narrator : The inn is full. A huge fireplace lights the room, everybody’s telling their day on sea. Alcohol is in the air.
column4: Narrator : The inn is absolutly empty this night… The keeper is half asleep on the counter, a few drinkers are blind drunk on the back tables.

column7: Narrator : The sunlight doesn’t go further into the room. Everything is plunged in obscurity and CAPITAINE doesn’t discern anything
PlayerSpeak : We can see much better
column8: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have any lantern

column5: Narrator : A handful of musicians are enlightening the tavern, at the back.

column3: OtherSpeak : How dare you step back into my establishment ?!

column1: OtherSpeak : What can I do for you
Choice : That will be all, thanks (partir)
column3: Choice : Rooms ! To spend the night (dormir)
column5: Choice : That’s new around the island ?
column7: Choice : Does NOMTRESOR ring any bell ?

column2: OtherSpeak : Take a look at the menu

column8: OtherSpeak : Obviously, all the drunks of the tavern talk about it.

column2: OtherSpeak : Sorry, sailor, that’s not enough gold

column1: OtherSpeak : Take the dortory, left after the stairs
Narrator : Crackling in the room wakes the crew

column7: Narrator : The crew wakes up to the sound of seagulls and waves, then go back to the main room.
column8: Narrator : The crew wakes up in the middle of the night to the hoos of a few howls. Downstairs, only the innkeeper is cleaning the counter.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE glimpses the innkeeper, his hands deep in the crew’s bags

column4: Narrator : The crew wakes up. The bursaries are way more light.
PlayerSpeak : My gold ! Who took my gold !

column7: Choice : It was like I slept on a ROCK

column6: OtherSpeak : You already took one of our men, that’s enough

column1: Narrator : A group of armed men is drinking
column4: OtherSpeak : You souldn’t have come back !
column9: Choice : How much for one of your men ?(trade)

column11: OtherSpeak : That’s cute but you don’t have the gold, boy

column1: Narrator : At the back of the tavern, a man has displayed random items on a table.
column7: Choice : Show me what your selling ?
OtherSpeak : First of all, you need to say please
OtherSpeak : Then, all sorts of things, really.
Choice : I say please if I want to

column1: Narrator : Apart from a few sleeping drunks, the back of the tavern is empty.
Narrator : Two men are playing cards on a table.
Narrator : Nobody’s in the tavern anymore.

column6: Narrator : The pantry door is half-opened
column9: Narrator : The pantry door is closed

column1: PlayerSpeak : Nothing to do here anymore
column2: PlayerSpeak : We need another good night of sleep

column9: Choice : (go back to the main room)(partir)

column3: PlayerSpeak : All the doors are closed
column12: PlayerSpeak : The door is wide open

column4: PlayerSpeak : The door is wide open
